v.v: The message that Habakkuk the prophet received,
“Yahweh, how long will I cry for help, and you will not hear?
Why do you make me see iniquity and look upon wrongdoing?
Therefore the law is weakened, and justice does not last for any time.

v: I cry out to you, ‘Violence!’ but you will not save.
Destruction and violence are before me; there is strife, and contention rises up.
For the wicked surround the righteous; therefore false justice goes out.”

v.v: “Look at the nations and examine them; be amazed and astonished!
For look! I am about to raise up the Chaldeans—that fierce and impetuous nation—
They are terrifying and fearsome; their judgment and splendor proceed from themselves.
Their horses also are swifter than leopards, quicker than the evening wolves.
So they mock kings, and rulers are only a mockery for them.
Then the wind will rush on; it will move past—guilty men, those whose might is their god.”

v: For I am surely about to do something in your days that you will not believe when it is reported to you.
they are marching throughout the breadth of the land to seize homes that were not their own.
and their horsemen come from a great distance—they fly like an eagle hurrying to eat.
their multitudes go like the desert wind, and they gather captives like sand.
They laugh at every stronghold, for they heap up earth and take them.

v.v: “Are you not from ancient times, Yahweh my God, my Holy One? We will not die.
Your eyes are too pure to gaze upon evil, and you are not able to look on wrongdoing with favor;
You make men like fish in the sea, like creeping things without a ruler over them.
He brings all of them up with a fishhook;
Therefore he sacrifices to his net
Will he therefore keep emptying his net,
I will stand at my guard post and station myself on the watchtower,

v: Yahweh has ordained them for judgment, and you, Rock, have established them for correction.
why then have you looked favorably on those who betray?
Why are you silent while the wicked swallow up those more righteous than they are?
he drags men away in his fishnet;
he gathers them together in his dragnet;
so he rejoices and he is glad.
and burns incense to his dragnet,
for by his net he lives in luxury,
and his food is the richest kind.
and will he continually slaughter the nations without mercy?”
